page.title: 02Tourism:
page.content: The proximity of the Lake District, the Pennines,the Yorkshire Dales and the Scottish Borders make Langwathby and Edenhall an ideal tourist area. The Eden valley offers visitors a rich variety of scenery.Small,unspoilt villages offer their own attractions of working water mills,stone circles and craft work.In the upper reaches of the valley there is wild moorland.Two long distance walks are the Pennine Way and Maiden Way.These give visitors the opportunity of fell walking in an area overlooking the four northern counties.The lower reaches have sand stone cliffs at Nunnery Walks and Lacey Caves.The characteristic stone arch bridge was washed away in heavy floods in 1968.A new one was provided very quickly by the army. That Bailey bridge is still in use today.We look forward to having a new bridge one day
